original_solution_mapping.L1: If he fires a bullet in the same direction as the direction that the horse is running, the total speed of the bullet is the sum of the speed the bullet was propelled out of the gun plus the speed of the horse, for a combined speed of 400+20=<<400+20=420>>420 feet per second.
original_solution_mapping.L2: If he fires a bullet in the opposite direction as the direction in which the horse is running, then the total speed of the bullet is the speed the bullet was propelled out of the gun minus the speed of the horse, for a resulting speed of 400-20=<<400-20=380>>380 feet per second.
original_solution_mapping.L3: Thus, when firing the gun in the same direction as the horse is running, the bullet moves at 420-380=<<420-380=40>>40 feet per second faster than when he fires the bullet in the opposite direction as what the horse is running.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6663.
    Returns: how much faster the bullet flies when fired in the same direction as the horse.
    """
    # L1
    bullet_speed_from_gun = 400 # a bullet fired from his gun flies at a speed of 400 feet per second
    horse_speed = 20 # His horse runs at 20 feet per second
    speed_same_direction = bullet_speed_from_gun + horse_speed

    # L2
    speed_opposite_direction = bullet_speed_from_gun - horse_speed

    # L3
    speed_difference = speed_same_direction - speed_opposite_direction

    # FA
    answer = speed_difference
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: If he fires a bullet in the same direction as the direction that the horse is running, the total speed of the bullet is the sum of the speed the bullet was propelled out of the gun plus the speed of the horse, for a combined speed of {bullet_speed_from_gun}+{horse_speed}=<<{bullet_speed_from_gun}+{horse_speed}={speed_same_direction}>>{speed_same_direction} feet per second.

If he fires a bullet in the opposite direction as the direction in which the horse is running, then the total speed of the bullet is the speed the bullet was propelled out of the gun minus the speed of the horse, for a resulting speed of {bullet_speed_from_gun}-{horse_speed}=<<{bullet_speed_from_gun}-{horse_speed}={speed_opposite_direction}>>{speed_opposite_direction} feet per second.

Thus, when firing the gun in the same direction as the horse is running, the bullet moves at {speed_same_direction}-{speed_opposite_direction}=<<{speed_same_direction}-{speed_opposite_direction}={speed_difference}>>{speed_difference} feet per second faster than when he fires the bullet in the opposite direction as what the horse is running.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: If he fires a bullet in the same direction as the direction that the horse is running, the total speed of the bullet is the sum of the speed the bullet was propelled out of the gun plus the speed of the horse, for a combined speed of 400+400=<<400+400=800>>800 feet per second.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: If he fires a bullet in the opposite direction as the direction in which the horse is running, then the total speed of the bullet is the speed the bullet was propelled out of the gun minus the speed of the horse, for a resulting speed of 400-20=<<400-20=380>>380 feet per second.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: Thus, when firing the gun in the same direction as the horse is running, the bullet moves at 800-380=<<800-380=420>>420 feet per second faster than when he fires the bullet in the opposite direction as what the horse is running.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'bullet_speed_from_gun' (400) was used instead of 'horse_speed' (20).
